Description: Ostracon, large fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially black in section, the interior is thickly covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and remains of eight lines of Coptic text written in black ink, worn in parts, and containing portions of a letter.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.92)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87595) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87595)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 97 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
